sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: Protocol Form
sci:arg.sci:help: The path to a protocol that will render an HTML user interface for this protocol. This optional parameter is used by Web Port to provide a custom user interface for a protocol.

sci:arg.name: Reporting
sci:arg.sci:help: This group contains parameters specific to protocols containing Reporting components.

sci:arg.name: Reporting Stylesheet
sci:arg.sci:help: Specifies the name of a Stylesheet to be used by this protocol if any of the Reporting components have a Style selected in the Format and Position parameters.

sci:arg.name: Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: The Run On Grid parameter tells the server to run the protocol on the grid engine if SES is configured to run with grid integration.

sci:arg.name: Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: The Queue Name allows you to specify the name of the queue on the grid engine to submit the job to. Leave blank to specify the default queue.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: WebExports
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties which will be automatically exported if this protocol is published as a web service.

Each global property in the list is created with an empty value at the start of the protocol run.

sci:arg.name: Keep Alive
sci:arg.sci:help: Specifies if the process where this protocol is run should stay around for later use.

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ProtocolAutoLayout
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol AutoLayout

sci:arg.name: ComponentRevision
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Revision

sci:arg.name: ByReference
sci:arg.sci:help: By Ref

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: List themes available in the Semantic UI collection.

sci:arg.name: ProtocolScale2
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Scale

sci:arg.name: Protocol Sticky Notes
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Sticky Notes

sci:arg.name: Protocol Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Options

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: OriginalPackage
sci:arg.sci:help: OriginalPackage

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.name: Directory Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The path to the directory that will be searched for files or folders

sci:arg.name: Recurse Directories
sci:arg.sci:help: If True, the Directory Path will be searched recursively. If False, the list will only include items contained directly by the specified Directory Path.

sci:arg.name: Directory Path Authentication Options
sci:arg.sci:help: For http and https sources, you may optionally specify authentication information for the URL in the following parameters
sci:arg.sci:member: Directory Path Authentication Options Authentication Method
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable, specify an HTTP URL for the Directory Path'); Parameter('Directory Path') rlike '^https?:';

sci:arg.name: Directory Path Authentication Options Authentication Method
sci:arg.sci:help:
Determines which method to use during authentication with an HTTP or HTTPS directory.
  • Use Username and Password Parameters: Use the values provided by the component Source parameter group's Username and Password parameters.
  • Use Pipeline Pilot Credentials: Use the username and password that were provided when the user logged into Pipeline Pilot. NOTE: if the Username parameter is provided, its value will override the user's logged in username.

sci:arg.name: Directory Path Authentication Options Username
sci:arg.sci:help:
The username used to connect to the supplied URL Directory.

If the Authentication Method is set to 'Use Username and Password Parameters', then this parameter must be filled in to log into the remote server.

If the Authentication Method is set to 'Use Pipeline Pilot Credentials', then this parameter can be left empty and the logged in username is used. As an override option, if the username is filled in, this username will be used along with the user's Pipeline Pilot password.

sci:arg.name: Directory Path Authentication Options Password
sci:arg.sci:help: The password used to authenticate with the Directory's server. This parameter is disabled if Authentication Method is not set to 'Use Username and Password Parameters'.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("To enable, set Authentication Method to 'Use Username and Password Parameters'"); Parameter('Directory Path Authentication Options Authentication Method') eq 'Use Username and Password Parameters';

sci:arg.name: Filter
sci:arg.sci:help:
A regular expression used to identify the files or subdirectories that should be returned. The component uses Perl regular expression syntax.

Examples:

  • .* will return all files or subdirectories
  • \.txt$ will return all .txt files
  • \.(sd|sdf)$ will return all .sd and .sdf files
  • ^Assay will return all files whose names start with "Assay"

sci:arg.name: Additional Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Contains less commonly used parameters

sci:arg.name: Property
sci:arg.sci:help: Name of the property that will be added to the data stream which contains the path to the files or subdirectories.

sci:arg.name: Search Type
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to search the Directory Path for files or for subdirectories

sci:arg.name: Additional Properties
sci:arg.sci:help:
Additional properties for each file or subdirectory that should be added to the property list.
The size property is in bytes. If greater than 2147483647, the output property is a double precision value, otherwise an integer.
The date properties are pilot DateTimeValues and can be manipulated with the appropriate DateTime pilotscript functions. The utility of the Last Accessed Date depends on the operating system.
The file name property is extracted directly as the leaf item from the full path.
Note that adding file system properties will incur some additional overhead, so be sure to switch off any properties that you are not using.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Lists the files or folders in the specified directory on the server or from an HTTP WebDav server such as Microsoft SharePoint

This component generates a list of filenames in the specified directory. The Search Type parameter can be switched to search for Subdirectory names as required.

One data record is generated for each file found in Directory Path. To list files recursively in subfolders within Directory Path, Recurse Directories should be True.

Filter is a regular expression used to specify which files to return from each searched directory.

The Additional Properties parameter can be set to add selected meta data properties to the output, related to the named file or directory.

For HTTP WebDav document repositories such as Microsoft SharePoint, you can specify an HTTP url as the Directory Path and include authentication options for connecting to the remote server.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.
sci:arg.sci:value: Components\Data Access and Manipulation\Utilities\File Utilities\List Files

sci:arg.name: Expression
sci:arg.sci:help: Expression (or list of expressions separated by semi-colons) to evaluate.

sci:arg.name: Initial Expression
sci:arg.sci:help:
This expression is executed only the first time data passes into the component.

Since there is no data available at initialization time, only expressions referencing local or global properties are allowed.

sci:arg.name: Final Expression
sci:arg.sci:help:
This expression is executed only at finalization (after the last data passes out of the component).

Since there is no data available at finalization time, only expressions referencing local or global properties are allowed.

sci:arg.name: Keep Calculated Properties
sci:arg.sci:help: Adds any properties calculated in this component to a data record's property list.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: OnDataTypeError
sci:arg.sci:help: When an expected data type is not found during processing: Halt: Terminate the execution of the network Fail: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Fail(red) port Pass: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Pass(green) port

sci:arg.name: OnGeneralError
sci:arg.sci:help: When an recoverable error occurs during processing: Halt: Terminate the execution of the network Fail: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Fail(red) port Pass: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Pass(green) port

sci:arg.name: CustomErrorText
sci:arg.sci:help: Custom Error Message

sci:arg.name: Do Screen
sci:arg.sci:help: When TRUE, controls which exit port is used for each data record by evaluating the final expression (or only one) listed in the "Expression" parameter. -Pass (green) port when expression true -Fail (red) port when expression false

sci:arg.name: ExpressionVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: Version of expression parser to use.

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAutoDisplayName
sci:arg.sci:help: Automatically update the component display name when the "Expression" property is changed. This feature is turned off after the user manually changes the display name of the component in Protocol workspace.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Applies a PilotScript expression to each data record

PilotScript is the native scripting language in Pipeline Pilot. It is based on PL/SQL and allows you to query or alter the properties on data records. For example, the expression:

A := 10;
creates a property named "A" and sets the value to "10".

For each incoming data record the PilotScript statements in Expression are evaluated.

Notes:

  • To initialize global variables such as counters, use Initial Expression.
  • To clean up global variables or calculate final results use Final Expression.
  • Parameters on Custom Manipulators do not become global variables that can be accessed via @ParameterName syntax. They must be accessed by using the Parameter('ParameterName') function or by using token substitution via $(ParameterName) syntax.

See Also:

  • For more information on PilotScript, see PilotScript Overview.
  • To use PilotScript to filter data records use Custom Filter (PilotScript).

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.

sci:arg.name: Merge Behavior
sci:arg.sci:help: Options controlling the details of how properties are merged together

sci:arg.name: WhenMerging
sci:arg.sci:help:
Provides fine control over how multiple values are treated when merging data records together.

  • OverwriteOrCreate: Copies all properties of each merged record sequentially, overwriting any values that may already exist (instead of generating an array).
  • OverwriteExisting: Only copies properties that already exist on the first merged record, overwriting those original values (instead of creating an array).
  • CreateIfNew: Leaves any existing properties alone, and writes only new properties.
  • AppendOrCreate: Appends (as an array) if a property already exists, otherwise creates it.
  • AppendExisting: Appends (as an array) only to currently existing properties, and discards other new property values.

sci:arg.name: KeepAllNullString
sci:arg.sci:help: This string is used during append to pad out empty values. It keeps the number of values of generated arrays of values the same, and in sync, for multiple samples. The default value is None, which causes no padding to occur.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable, set MergeBehavior to KeepAll'); Parameter('MergeBehavior') eq 'KeepAll'

sci:arg.name: KeepAllPreferredNodeName
sci:arg.sci:help: If defined, this contains a name that is used to prioritize which underlying data record should be kept. If not defined, the first data record is kept; if this is defined, and at least one of the data records contains a node of this type, then the first example of that type is kept.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable, set MergeBehavior to KeepAll'); Parameter('MergeBehavior') eq 'KeepAll'

sci:arg.name: PrefixUsingProperty
sci:arg.sci:help: When multiple values for a property are retained, the original property name is prefixed differently for each original value it must hold. The prefix is constructed from the value of this property, followed by an underscore. When not specified, a prefix is not used and multiple values are separated as an array (such as property[1], property[2], etc).

sci:arg.name: OutputFrequency
sci:arg.sci:help: Add a property called "Frequency" that contains the number of individual data records included in the resulting merged record. This value is simply the total number of input records.

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: MergeBehavior
sci:arg.sci:help:
Controls how properties, other than the MergeUsing property, are handled.

  • KeepAll: Keeps all property values by appending values into an array.
  • KeepFirst: Keeps only the properties and values from the first example received. All properties and values from subsequent records matching the property specified by MergeUsing are discarded.

sci:arg.name: MergeUsing
sci:arg.sci:help:
Name of the property (or a comma-separated list of properties) that will be used to merge on. Data records having the same value for this property will be merged. This property must contain scalar (i.e., non-array) data.

If multiple properties are specified, the values must be the same for all of the properties (unless MergeUsingListType is set to UseFirstDefinedValue).

sci:arg.name: MergeUsingListType
sci:arg.sci:help:
How MergeUsing properties are interpreted when more than one property is listed:

  • UseFirstDefinedValue: Use only the first property in the list that has a defined value for a record as the merge key.
  • UseAllValues: Use the concatentation of values of all properties listed as the merge key.

sci:arg.name: MergePropertyType
sci:arg.sci:help:
The types of values found in the property specified by MergeUsing:

  • IsNumeric: All numbers are converted to doubles for comparison (e.g., 1 = 1.0).
  • IsText: All comparisons are made as string values.
  • IsDate: The key is considered a date.
  • IsFingerprint: The key is considered a fingerprint. Fingerprint bits are sorted before making the comparison.

sci:arg.name: IgnoreCase
sci:arg.sci:help: Considers lower-case and upper-case letters as equivalent when determining the identity of MergeUsing property values.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable, set MergePropertyType to IsText'); Parameter('MergePropertyType') eq 'IsText'

sci:arg.name: AcceptNonNumericStringsAsNumbers
sci:arg.sci:help: Determines whether all string values for the MergeUsing property -- even non-numeric ones such as 'abc' or '1.0c' -- will be coerced to numbers when MergePropertyType is set to IsNumeric. If set to True, then a string such as 'abc' that does not begin with a numeric portion will be coerced to zero, while a string such as '1.0c' that begins with a numeric portion will be coerced to the corresponding number (in this case 1.0). If set to False, then records containing non-numeric strings for the MergeUsing property will be sent out the Fail port.

sci:arg.name: Registrant
sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate
sci:arg.sci:help: The date this component was registered.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Merges properties of all input data records into a single output data record

Performs faster than Merge Data for the special case where all input records are to be merged into one. MergeBehavior controls how properties are handled.

See Also:

  • If you wish to merge data records that share identical values of a specified property, use Merge Data.
A single data record containing all merged properties of the input records

sci:arg.name: RegistrationVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: The server version when this component was registered

sci:arg.name: ReplaceNullsInFirstRecord
sci:arg.sci:help: Specifies whether to replace nulls in the first merged record when KeepAllNullString is specified.

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Merge All
sci:arg.sci:help: Internal parameter indicating that all data records are to be merged into one, irrespective of the value of the MergeUsing Property.

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.
sci:arg.sci:value: Components\Data Access and Manipulation\Manipulators\Merge All Data

sci:arg.name: Expression
sci:arg.sci:help: Expression (or list of expressions separated by semi-colons) to evaluate.

sci:arg.name: Initial Expression
sci:arg.sci:help:
This expression is executed only the first time data passes into the component.

Since there is no data available at initialization time, only expressions referencing local or global properties are allowed.

sci:arg.name: Final Expression
sci:arg.sci:help:
This expression is executed only at finalization (after the last data passes out of the component).

Since there is no data available at finalization time, only expressions referencing local or global properties are allowed.

sci:arg.name: Keep Calculated Properties
sci:arg.sci:help: Adds any properties calculated in this component to a data record's property list.

sci:arg.name: OnDataTypeError
sci:arg.sci:help: When an expected data type is not found during processing: Halt: Terminate the execution of the network Fail: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Fail(red) port Pass: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Pass(green) port

sci:arg.name: OnGeneralError
sci:arg.sci:help: When an recoverable error occurs during processing: Halt: Terminate the execution of the network Fail: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Fail(red) port Pass: Continue execution of the network, passing data out the Pass(green) port

sci:arg.name: CustomErrorText
sci:arg.sci:help: Custom Error Message

sci:arg.name: Do Screen
sci:arg.sci:help: When TRUE, controls which exit port is used for each data record by evaluating the final expression (or only one) listed in the "Expression" parameter. -Pass (green) port when expression true -Fail (red) port when expression false

sci:arg.name: ExpressionVersion
sci:arg.sci:help: Version of expression parser to use.

sci:arg.sci:help: The user who registered this component.

sci:arg.name: RegistrationDate

sci:arg.name: ComponentAutoDisplayName
sci:arg.sci:help: Automatically update the component display name when the "Expression" property is changed. This feature is turned off after the user manually changes the display name of the component in Protocol workspace.

sci:arg.name: DerivedFrom
sci:arg.sci:help: The component this component is based upon.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Applies a PilotScript expression to each data record

PilotScript is the native scripting language in Pipeline Pilot. It is based on PL/SQL and allows you to query or alter the properties on data records. For example, the expression:

A := 10;
creates a property named "A" and sets the value to "10".

For each incoming data record the PilotScript statements in Expression are evaluated.

Notes:

  • To initialize global variables such as counters, use Initial Expression.
  • To clean up global variables or calculate final results use Final Expression.
  • Parameters on Custom Manipulators do not become global variables that can be accessed via @ParameterName syntax. They must be accessed by using the Parameter('ParameterName') function or by using token substitution via $(ParameterName) syntax.

See Also:

  • For more information on PilotScript, see PilotScript Overview.
  • To use PilotScript to filter data records use Custom Filter (PilotScript).

sci:arg.name: ComponentLocalID
sci:arg.sci:help: Local Component Identifier

sci:arg.name: Component Path

sci:arg.name: ComponentIcon
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Icon

sci:arg.name: Protocol Sticky Notes
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol Sticky Notes
sci:arg.sci:value: WARNING! This is a Pipeline Pilot protocol written in version 8.0 or later. It contains features that are not supported in earlier versions of Pipeline Pilot.
